author: Nimrah Khatoon
title: Southwest Airlines Toasts to Tradition: Free Drinks on Special Holidays
text:
Freebies on airlines are a rare find in today's cost-cutting climate, but Southwest Airlines stands out with its generous offering of two free checked bags and select complimentary beverages. Known for its customer-centric amenities, Southwest also celebrates four key holidays by offering all passengers of legal drinking age a free alcoholic beverage, embedding a unique tradition within its corporate culture.
Special Occasions for Complimentary Cheers
Southwest's selection of free drink days is no random choice; each holiday reflects an aspect of the airline's identity and values. Valentine's Day is a nod to the airline's heart logo and its home base at Dallas Love Field, symbolizing love and hospitality. St. Patrick's Day honors the Irish heritage of Southwest's founder, while Southwest's Birthday on June 18 and Halloween showcase the airline's history of festive celebration and employee engagement. On these days, passengers can choose from a variety of spirits, wines, beers, and special canned cocktails, including Hawaiian specials on flights to Hawaii.
More Than Just Drinks
Southwest's commitment to customer appreciation extends beyond free drinks. The airline frequently launches sales around these holidays, such as the recent Valentine's Day $49 flight sale. For those not flying on one of the special days, Southwest still offers ways to enjoy a complimentary beverage, like the Business Select fare which includes a free drink coupon and priority boarding. Although the frequent flyer free drink coupon program is currently on pause, Southwest's unique approach to celebrating holidays stands out in the airline industry.
A Toast to Tradition and Hospitality
Southwest Airlines' tradition of celebrating holidays with free drinks is a testament to its dedication to customer satisfaction and company culture. By marking these occasions, Southwest not only enhances the flying experience but also strengthens its brand identity as a warm and welcoming airline. As the only airline to incorporate such a policy, Southwest sets itself apart, proving that even small gestures can leave a lasting impression on passengers.
While some may wish for more free drink days, Southwest's initiative to celebrate with its customers on these four special holidays reflects a commendable blend of tradition, hospitality, and appreciation. It's a unique way to say thank you to passengers, reinforcing the airline's reputation as a customer-friendly company.
